definition: palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: A burst of hand-clapping followed the end of the song.
sentences.chinese: 歌声结束后是一阵热烈的掌声。

sentences.english: She waited until the applause had died down, then spoke again.
sentences.chinese: 她等到掌声变小了，才又开始说话。

sentences.english: This performance was a success and he was greeted by enthusiastic applause.
sentences.chinese: 这场音乐会相当成功，马友友被报以热烈的掌声。

sentences.english: A burst of hand-clapping followed the ending of the story.
sentences.chinese: 在故事的结尾爆发了一阵阵掌声。

sentences.english: I do not personate the stage-play emperor to entrap applause.
sentences.chinese: 我不扮演戏台上的国王骗取掌声。

sentences.english: The audience loaded the champion with thunderous applause.
sentences.chinese: 观众向冠军报以暴风雨般的掌声。

sentences.english: After his speech, applause went on endlessly.
sentences.chinese: 讲话结束后，掌声络绎不绝。

sentences.english: Ambassador Liu's gracious speech and answers were rewarded with rounds of ardent applause from the audience.
sentences.chinese: 现场听众对刘大使的精彩演讲和答问报以热烈掌声。

sentences.english: There was prolonged applause when he began to speak.
sentences.chinese: 他开始讲话时响起了经久不息的掌声。

sentences.english: The room erupted again into wild cheers and applause.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里再次爆发出热烈的欢呼和掌声。

sentences.english: They were still applauding when the curtain rang down for the final time.
sentences.chinese: 最后一次鸣铃落幕时，他们的掌声依然不息。

sentences.english: The student finishes singing the Rwandan national anthem, and takes in the applause.
sentences.chinese: 学生们唱毕卢旺达国歌，教室里响起热烈地掌声。

sentences.english: The Bureau Chief Sun voice just fell, the scene fan erupts the warm applause.
sentences.chinese: 孙局长的话音刚落，现场的球迷就爆发出热烈的掌声。

sentences.english: It is always the latest song that an audience applauds the most.
sentences.chinese: 通常是最后一首歌得到的观众的掌声最多。

sentences.english: Now welcome Mr. Wu to make a speech!
sentences.chinese: 现在让我们用掌声欢迎吴校长讲话。

sentences.english: I kept hearing the sound of applause in the background.
sentences.chinese: 我不断听到隐约的鼓掌声。

definition: hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
to boo or jeer (as a sign of displeasure at an actor)
adverse audience reaction: boos and jeers, hissing, catcalls or deliberate applause after a mistake
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
